content: The FCC prepared to auction 62 MHz of radio frequencies in the 700 MHz band to comply with the Deficit Reduction Act. Rules were issued for spectrum allocation, auction, public safety use, and creating a public-private partnership for a network. 24 MHz had already been set aside for public safety in the same bandwidth. The FCC proposed setting aside 10 MHz from public safety frequency bands to create a shared network with auctionable spectrum, totaling 20 MHz for a nationwide broadband network. This decision aimed to meet public safety needs for robust communications and interoperability through a shared network.
